sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The diamond sector in Antwerp is preparing to apply the newly agreed sanctions against Russian diamonds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: After months of deliberation, the new measures agreed between the G7 and EU countries will start working progressively from January the 1st. The first to be hit will be rough diamonds, of which Russia is the largest exporter globally, with 30% of the total production by volume. But tracking diamonds isn't easy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: This will be a blockchain system where the transformation of a diamond is fully recorded and that you can track basically what is going on with the diamonds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Every diamond that will be sold in countries that impose the sanctions will have to travel first to Antwerp in Belgium to be certified. Through this system, the Belgian city will not be as hard hit by the sanctions aimed at punishing Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: So Antwerp has been always the most important trading hub for diamonds, yes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: We were losing that with the current system in place, which I think is a really good system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Yeah, the flows will come back to the European Union and you'll have an impact.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Having both the G7 and EU on board was key to ensuring that the system would actually hit Russia and the diamonds will not be sold elsewhere, both by around 70 percent of diamonds globally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In 2021, Russia exported 400 billion dollars worth of diamonds, most of them by a single company, Arosa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: since the start of december its air quality is so bad it has ranked top on a list of the world's most polluted cities for two days in a row. The Swiss air technology company IQ air compiles a real-time list of city air quality rating from good to hazardous. On Wednesday it puts Sarajevo's air quality in the very unhealthy category. It's not a new problem. There have been protests by locals dating back to 2020. At the time, experts said air pollution in the Balkans was due in part to the use of coal-fueled power plants and old cars. Since then, the Sarajevo authorities have pledged to make the city carbon-free by 2035. But a cost-of-living crisis has forced people to rely on cheaper, dirtier fuels to heat their homes.
